intro: Scorzonella troximoides, commonly known as the Mediterranean scorzonella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its slender stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically thrives in dry, sandy soils and is native to regions across southern Europe and western Asia. Scorzonella troximoides produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to arid environments and it is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
